items.sentence: Tom put his money in the bottom drawer of his desk.
Tom says Mary needs more time to finish her report.
Tom seemed surprised when he saw Mary kissing John.
Tom stayed at a cheap hotel when he visited Boston.
Tom thinks he can succeed where others have failed.
Tom told Mary that she could do whatever she liked.
Don\'t forget to take an umbrella in case it rains.
Don\'t forget to take your umbrella when you leave.
Don\'t forget to turn the light off when you leave.
Don\'t you think that if I could help you, I would?
Even if I knew where Tom was, I wouldn\'t tell you.
I\'ve already told Tom I don\'t plan on doing that.
I\'ve already told Tom he doesn\'t need to do that.
I\'ve already told everybody I\'m moving to Boston.
It\'ll take some time to get used to wearing a wig.
It\'ll take us three, maybe four weeks at the most.
It\'s a good thing you have your umbrella with you.
It\'s better to be born lucky than to be born rich.
It\'s difficult to get out of bed on cold mornings.
Tom doesn\'t speak French and Mary doesn\'t either.
